questions.text: Select the structure that originates from the structure labeled as A.

A patient is brought into the emergency room after a severe car accident. The patient is unconscious and in critical condition, with multiple injuries. In this situation, the healthcare team may need to perform various surgical procedures, such as: Emergency surgery to stop internal bleeding Orthopedic surgery to repair broken bones Neurosurgery to relieve pressure on the brain Plastic surgery to address facial injuries Thoracic surgery to treat lung injuries Given the urgency of the situation and the patient's inability to provide specific consent, the healthcare team may ask a family member for consent to perform any necessary surgeries to stabilize and treat the patient's injuries, without giving details on specific type of surgery. This is a type of:
Rigor mortis be simulated by:
Following are true about transferable drug resistance except:

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple drugs are resistant at a time

questions.correct_answer: A. Drug combinations can prevent resistance
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Drug combinations can prevent resistance

options.label: C
options.text: Mobilization of the bladder wall from the vagina

options.label: D

questions.explanation: Ans. D. Suturing the bladder wall with tension in two layers

questions.text: Following a road traffic accident, a patient has been admitted and there is a blood spillage on the hospital floor. Which type of disinfectant would you select for cleaning the floor?

A 34-year-old primi at 34 weeks develops preeclampsia. She has no other comorbidities. She asks if this could have been prevented and how?

options.label: B
options.text: Starting low dose aspirin before 12 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Starting high dose aspirin before 12 weeks

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: B. Starting low dose aspirin before 12 weeks
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Starting low dose aspirin before 12 weeks

questions.text: A 28-year-old male patient presents with a history of progressive vision loss and night blindness. Upon examination, the patient displays characteristic retinal degeneration with peripheral bone spicule pigmentation. Which of the following syndromes is NOT likely associated with this clinical presentation?

A 34-year-old male patient with a history of HIV infection presents with recent laboratory findings showing elevated levels of liver enzymes. Further testing reveals that he is also co-infected with Hepatitis B Virus (HBV). The medical team is considering antiviral treatment that would act against both HIV and HBV. Which of the following antiviral drugs has dual antiviral activity against HIV and HBV?
Which of the following is not a correct match with respect to the mechanism of action and clinical use of the given drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: Zavegepant – CGRP receptor antagonist used for the treatment of acute migraine attacks

options.label: B
options.text: Sparsentan – Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

options.label: C
options.text: Lenacapavir – HIV-1 capsid inhibitor used for the treatment of HIV infection

options.label: D
options.text: Teplizumab – Anti-CD3 monoclonal antibody used for the prevention of type 1 diabetes in high-risk individuals

questions.correct_answer: B. Sparsentan – Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

questions.text: A middle-aged female on undergoing chest X-ray is found to have mediastinal widening. Upon further investigation, a 5.5 cm thoracic aortic aneurysm if found in descending aorta. What will be the next step?

options.label: C
options.text: Wait and watch till it becomes 6 cm

options.label: D
options.text: Wait and watch till it becomes 7 cm

questions.correct_answer: C. Wait and watch till it becomes 6 cm
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Wait and watch till it becomes 6 cm

A 65-year-old female patient is brought to the ER in a state of unconsciousness. Her BP is 70/50 mm of Hg. Her ECG is shown below. What is the next best step in the management of her condition?
Which of the following conditions is a potential cause of short stature in a 4-year-old child who came with complaint of not gaining weight & height?
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Turner syndrome is a genetic condition that can lead to short stature in females due to the absence or partial absence of one X chromosome.

questions.text: As compared to Billroth type 2 gastrectomy, Billroth type 1 gastrectomy is characterized by:

options.label: A
options.text: Anastomosis between stomach and 1 st part of duodenum

options.label: B
options.text: Anastomosis between stomach and 2 nd /3 rd part of duodenum

questions.correct_answer: A. Anastomosis between stomach and 1 st part of duodenum
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Anastomosis between stomach and 1stpart of duodenum

questions.text: A 30-year-old individual diagnosed with schizophrenia commits an act that would otherwise be considered a criminal offense. The act was committed during a period of acute psychotic episode. The individual's medical history indicates sporadic adherence to prescribed antipsychotic medication. The prosecution has charged the individual with the offense. Based on the provided information, which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the applicability of Section 84 of IPC in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: The accused cannot invoke Section 84 since the act was committed while not adhering to prescribed medication

options.label: B
options.text: Section 84 applies as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence

options.label: C
options.text: Section 84 is inapplicable due to the sporadic nature of the individual's symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: The accused can only invoke Section 84 if the act was committed during a state of complete unconsciousness

questions.correct_answer: B. Section 84 applies as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Section 84 applies if the accused's schizophrenia diagnosis is confirmed, regardless of medication adherence

questions.text: A hiker in a forested area is bitten by a snake while exploring. Hiker begins to experience symptoms such as swelling, pain, and bruising at the bite site. The hiker remains conscious but is anxious. What is the most appropriate initial first aid response for this snake bite?

options.label: A
options.text: Applying a tourniquet above the bite site to restrict blood flow and prevent venom spread

options.label: B
options.text: Cutting open the wound and attempting to suck out the venom

options.label: C
options.text: Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility

options.label: D
options.text: Applying ice packs directly to the bite area to reduce swelling and pain

questions.correct_answer: C. Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility

questions.text: A patient present with frequent urination, nocturia, and enuresis. 24-hour urine volume was measured and recorded to be 7 liters. The urine osmolarity was 260 mOsm/L. ADH assay was performed and the recorded values were reported as 0.8 pg/ml. An MRI of the brain was performed and T1 weighted indicated the absence of the bright spot. What is the most likely diagnosis?
According to the Factories Act of 1948, what is the maximum permissible weekly working hours, including of overtime?

A 45-year-old male presents to the emergency department with chest pain and shortness of breath. He has a history of heavy smoking and is known to have hypertension. An electrocardiogram (ECG) reveals changes consistent with an acute myocardial infarction (heart attack). The healthcare team orders laboratory tests, including a measurement of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) isoenzymes. The flipped LDH ratio is observed. What does this flipped LDH ratio imply regarding the LDH isoenzyme levels in this patient?
Which of the following zymogens requires gamma-glutamyl carboxylase?

options.label: B
options.text: Factors II, VII, IX, and X

questions.correct_answer: B. Factors II, VII, IX, and X
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Factors II, VII, IX, and X

questions.text: A 19-year-old male is brought to the emergency department by his concerned family. Over the past 4 days, he has become increasingly irritable, with markedly reduced sleep. On evaluation, the young man is observed to be speaking incessantly. Even when attempts are made to interrupt or redirect him, he persists with his verbalizations, claiming to have personal connections with the Prime Minister and the President of the country. Given the abruptness of onset and the observed clinical features, the decision is made to admit him to a psychiatric facility. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Mania

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective : The presence of symptoms like grandiosity, decreased need for sleep, and pressured speech can indicate manic episode, even if the duration criteria does not meet, provided it is severe enough for hospitalization.
  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 12 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 12 th edition

questions.text: Kawasaki disease is a rare pediatric vasculitis that primarily affects young children. Which of the following statements about Kawasaki disease is CORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: It typically presents with joint pain and arthritis

options.label: B
options.text: The primary cause of Kawasaki disease is a bacterial infection

options.label: C
options.text: One of its most critical complications is coronary artery aneurysm

options.label: D
options.text: It is more common in teenagers and adults than in young children

questions.correct_answer: C. One of its most critical complications is coronary artery aneurysm
questions.explanation: Ans. C. One of its most critical complications is coronary artery aneurysm

questions.text: Craniorachischisis is a severe congenital anomaly of the central nervous system. Which of the following statements about craniorachischisis is CORRECT?

options.label: B
options.text: Craniorachischisis typically occurs in isolation without other associated anomalies

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a form of neural tube defect (NTD)
questions.explanation: Ans. A. It is a form of neural tube defect (NTD)

questions.text: What levels of prolactin are definitely suggestive of prolactinoma?

A 58-year-old patient with a 15-year history of poorly controlled diabetes presents to the ophthalmology clinic with visual disturbances. On fundoscopic examination, you observe multiple haemorrhages, micro aneurysms, and hard exudates in both eyes. However, one eye has a presentation more than the other. There is a lesion near the macula with vascularization and fluid accumulation, causing severe visual impairment. The patient reports no recent trauma. Which of the following findings is atypical for diabetic retinopathy in this case?
PICA is a behaviour characterized by the persistent consumption of non-nutritive, non-food substances. Which of the following is a common example of a substance craved by individuals with PICA?

A 56-year-old previously healthy physician notices that his eyes are yellow and he has been losing weight. On physical examination, the patient has jaundice and scleral icterus with a palpable gall bladder lump. Transcutaneous ultrasound of the abdomen demonstrates biliary ductal dilation without gallstones. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the workup of this patient?
Total Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Connection (TAPVC) is a congenital heart defect involving the abnormal connection of pulmonary veins. Which of the following statements about TAPVC is CORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: In TAPVC, pulmonary veins connect normally to the left atrium

options.label: B
options.text: TAPVC allows for normal oxygenated blood flow to the body

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical correction is not typically required for TAPVC

options.label: D
options.text: TAPVC results in pulmonary veins connecting abnormally to the right atrium

questions.correct_answer: D. TAPVC results in pulmonary veins connecting abnormally to the right atrium
questions.explanation: Ans. D. TAPVC results in pulmonary veins connecting abnormally to the right atrium

questions.text: An ultrasound is performed on a patient with right upper quadrant pain. It demonstrates a large gallstone in the cystic duct but also a polypoid mass in the fundus. Which of the following is an indication for cholecystectomy for a polypoid gallbladder lesion?

questions.text: A 57-year-old woman presents with adenocarcinoma of the right colon. Laboratory evaluation demonstrates an elevation of carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) to 123 ng/mL. Which of the following is the most appropriate use of CEA testing in patients with colorectal cancer?

questions.correct_answer: D. To monitor for post-operative recurrence

You are examining a primigravida in the second stage of labor. She has been fully dilated since 3 hours and is tired. On examination, contractions are adequate, the cervix is fully dilated with the head at +2 station. The contractions are good. There is mild caput and no moulding. The sagittal suture is in the right occipito-anterior position. The fetal heart rate is 150 beats/minute with occasional decelerations up to 100 bpm with contractions. Which of the following is the next best step?

options.label: C
options.text: Wait for an hour for spontaneous labor

questions.text: All are caused by staphylococcal infection except:

A 4-year-old child was brought to the pediatric outpatient clinic, weighing 11 kilograms. The child displayed a respiratory rate of 40 breaths per minute, and during the examination, chest indrawing was observed. What should be the subsequent course of action in terms of management?

options.label: B

options.text: Administer IV antibiotics and ask the patient to be brought after 24 hours

She is currently on low dose aspirin and prenatal vitamins. On examination, the uterus is SFH is 38 cm and FHR is 140 bpm. To minimize the risk of transplant rejection, the medical team is considering the use of an immunosuppressive agent that specifically targets T-cell activation without causing generalized immunosuppression. Among the options, they are discussing basiliximab. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of basiliximab?

A 55-year-old man presents with complaints of facial swelling, frothy urine, and elevated blood pressure. He reports a previous hepatitis B infection. Microscopic examination of the urine reveals the presence of small amounts of blood. The kidney biopsy's histopathological image displays a characteristic spike and dome pattern. What is the diagnosis for this case?

A 16-year-old patient presented to the clinic with a history of malabsorption, diarrhea, and poor appetite. Examination of a duodenal biopsy from this patient revealed crypt hyperplasia, villi atrophy, and the presence of CD8+ cells within the lamina propria. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
Which of the following is associated with Stellate granuloma?

In a well-designed cancer study, comparable rates of remission were achieved for both a new treatment (33.2%) and the conventional treatment (32.2%). The corresponding p-value was recorded as 0.04. Which of the following statements is true regarding the study?

options.label: A
options.text: Both the treatments are equally effective

options.label: B
options.text: Neither of the treatments is effective

options.label: C
options.text: The new treatment is more effective than the usual treatment

options.label: D
options.text: The information given is not adequate to compare the efficacy of the treatments

questions.correct_answer: C. The new treatment is more effective than the usual treatment
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The new treatment is more effective than the usual treatment

questions.text: A 65-year-old male patient with a history of coronary artery disease is being evaluated in the cardiology clinic. The cardiologist is considering to add a new antiplatelet agent to his treatment regimen to reduce the risk of stent thrombosis. Prasugrel is one of the options under consideration. Which of the following statements is true about prasugrel?

options.label: A
options.text: It acts as an P2 Y12 agonist

options.label: B
options.text: It is 10 times less potent than clopidogrel

options.label: D
options.text: Omeprazole interferes with metabolism of prasugrel leading to increased risk of bleeding

questions.text: A 60-year-old man sees a urologist for what he describes as bloody urine. A urine sample is positive for cytologic evidence of malignancy. Cystoscopy confirms the presence of superficial transitional cell carcinoma. Which of the following is the recommended treatment for stage A (superficial and submucosal) transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder?
questions.correct_answer: D. Local excision and topical (intravesicular) chemotherapy
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Local excision and topical (intravesicular) chemotherapy

The child presents with peeling skin rash, swelling in the hands and feet, redness of the palms and soles, oral redness, and enlarged cervical lymph nodes. What is the probable medical condition?

A 50-year-old patient presents to the outpatient department complaining of fatigue, weariness, and swelling in the neck's lymph nodes. Initial blood tests, including total lymphocyte count (TLC) and differential lymphocyte count (DLC), showed normal results with no signs of immature cells. Subsequently, a lymph node biopsy was conducted, revealing a diffuse disruption of the lymph node structure, atypical cells characterized by an indented nucleus and prominent nucleolus. Immunohistochemical staining displayed positivity for CD10 and BCL2. What is the probable diagnosis?
In a patient presenting with a third heart sound (S3) on auscultation, which phase of the cardiac cycle is most likely associated with this finding?
According to Biomedical Waste Management guidelines, cytotoxic and expired medications are appropriately discarded by:
Which of the following nerve fibers is primarily responsible for the motor supply to the intrafusal muscle fibers within the muscle spindle, playing a crucial role in proprioceptive function?
During a yawn, a student experienced a jaw locking incident. Identify the muscle attached to the articular disc of the temporomandibular joint?

An individual who has been regularly exposed to benzene due to his occupation, is now presenting with symptoms such as recurrent infections, fatigue, unexplained weight loss, and a rise in temperature during the evening. This sustained exposure to benzene is associated with an increased susceptibility to which type of cancer?
A patient was undergoing clinical evaluation during which the marked structure was stimulated. Which of the following nerves was being tested?

A 40-year-old male Prakash presents to his primary care physician Dr. Dileep with complaints of fatigue, easy bruising, and night sweats. On physical examination, splenomegaly is noted. He is referred to Cerebellum Pathology Lab where the complete blood count reveals an elevated white blood cell count with a left shift, increased basophils, and increased myeloid cells. She reports sudden onset of worsening symptoms for last 5 days. Which of the following is a criterion for the diagnosis of accelerated phase of chronic myeloid leukemia according to WHO 2017 criteria?

options.label: A
options.text: 5-10% blasts in bone marrow or peripheral blood

options.label: B
options.text: Persistent platelet count < 100,000 related to therapy

options.label: D
options.text: Additional clonal chromosomal abnormalities like trisomy 8, isochromosome 17q

questions.correct_answer: D. Additional clonal chromosomal abnormalities like trisomy 8, isochromosome 17q
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Additional clonal chromosomal abnormalities like trisomy 8, isochromosome 17q

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding neutrophil extracellular trapping (NET) except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is detected in blood during sepsis

options.label: B
options.text: It is produced in response to bacterial infection

options.label: D
options.text: It is chromatin with antibacterial enzymes

questions.text: A 36-year-old man presents to the emergency room with renal colic. His vital signs are normal and a urinalysis shows microscopic haematuria. A radiograph reveals a 1.5 cm stone in pelvis. Which of the following is the most appropriate management of this patient?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the modified Duke's criteria?

options.label: A
options.text: Single positive blood culture for HACEK group is a major criterion

options.label: B
options.text: Single positive blood culture for Coxiella Burnetti is a major criterion

options.label: D
options.text: Documentation of four minor criterion allows a clinical diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Single positive blood culture for Coxiella Burnetti is a major criterion
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Single positive blood culture for Coxiella Burnetti is a major criterion

questions.text: During a physical examination, lung function tests are performed. The results show that the sum of tidal volume, inspiratory reserve volume, and expiratory reserve volume in the lungs is significantly reduced. What is the term used to describe the reduced sum of these lung volumes in this patient?
Which nerve innervates the marked muscle?

options.label: C
options.text: From the dorsal rami of C1

questions.text: What is the maximum duration for TRALI to manifest following a blood transfusion?

A 50-year-old male recently underwent surgery to remove a parathyroid gland due to hyperparathyroidism. The surgeon informed the patient that one or more of the parathyroid glands may be transferred to another location during the surgery. The parathyroid is commonly transferred to?

A 16-year-old girl presents to the clinic with a 48-hour history of itching and oozing from a lesion behind her ear. She states that the symptoms began a day after she started wearing a new pair of gold earrings. On physical examination, the area behind her earlobe reveals an erythematous, weepy patch that corresponds to where the earring's backing would rest. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in confirming the diagnosis?
Identify the procedure being done in this image.
What is the observational unit in ecological investigations?
A 30-year-old HIV-positive man presents with fever for 3 weeks, dry cough, and significant weight loss. His HRCT thorax is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the Child-Turcotte-Pugh class for the patient who has a serum bilirubin 2.5 mg/dl, serum albumin 3 g/dl, prothrombin time 5 seconds (INR = 2), no encephalopathy, and mild ascites?

A 52-year-old female patient is undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer. The oncology team is concerned about the risk of febrile neutropenia due to the chemotherapeutic regimen. They are contemplating the use of a granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) and discuss the option of using pegylated-filgrastim. Which of the following is true about pegylated-filgrastim?

options.label: A
options.text: Duration of action is longer than filgrastim

options.label: B
options.text: Added advantage is that it can be taken orally

options.label: D
options.text: It is not effective in the treatment of severe neutropenia

questions.correct_answer: A. Duration of action is longer than filgrastim
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Duration of action is longer than filgrastim

questions.text: A 67-year-old male patient is diagnosed with chronic syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH) secondary to a small cell lung cancer. The patient's serum sodium levels have been consistently low despite initial conservative management. The healthcare team is considering various treatment approaches to best manage his condition. What is the best approach in the treatment of chronic SIADH?

options.label: B
options.text: Reducing fluid intake to <500 ml per day

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the dose-response curve shown in the image below?

A female patient has been receiving first-line pharmacological treatment for bipolar disorder for 6 months. She is fasting for religious reasons and is experiencing seizures, coarse tremors, confusion, and limb weakness. Which of the following tests should be performed to help diagnose her condition?
Which of the following is an inhibitor of RNA synthesis?

A 62-year-old man with chronic liver disease is experiencing recurrent urinary tract infections. His healthcare team is considering various antibiotics, including fluoroquinolones, to treat the infection. Which of the following fluoroquinolones is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease?

A young patient began taking a weight loss medication that works by preventing fat absorption from food. She developed easy bruising and increased menstrual bleeding after a few weeks. Deficiency of which of the following vitamins is most likely responsible for these symptoms?
Which of the options is considered the most peripheral center under the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Designated Microscopy Centre

References:

  • ↳ Among the given options, the most peripheral center under the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme organization structure is the Designated Microscopy Centre (DMC).
  • ↳ The DMC is the first point of contact for patients seeking diagnosis and treatment for tuberculosis (TB) and is responsible for collecting sputum samples and conducting smear microscopy to detect the presence of TB bacteria. The DMCs are established at the periphery level of the healthcare system, such as at the level of Primary Health Centers or Community Health Centers, to ensure that TB diagnosis and treatment services are accessible to people in their own communities.
  • ↳ The other options mentioned are also important components of the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme organization structure. The District TB Centre (DTC) is responsible for overall supervision and monitoring of TB control activities in the district. The Intermediate Reference Laboratory (IRL) provides quality assurance for TB diagnosis and drug susceptibility testing. The Tuberculosis Unit (TU) is responsible for providing treatment and care to TB patients.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man presents to the emergency department with severe chest pain after eating a piece of steak. The pain started suddenly and radiates to his back. He also reports difficulty swallowing, and is drooling saliva. His vital signs are stable. Physical examination reveals tenderness over the lower chest and upper abdomen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

The cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) specimen of a patient is shown below along with the microscopy. The report shows mononuclear cytosis, elevated proteins, and low sugars. Which of the following is the likely etiology?
A female patient presents to you with unilateral headache. It is associated with nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. What is the drug of choice for acute management?
Which of the following infectious agent causes neonatal meningitis as acquired through infected birth canal?

A 48-year-old immunocompromised patients attended the emergency block with complaints of abdominal pain, vomiting and dyspnea. On examination and baseline investigation, he was diagnosed as gastrointestinal perforation with paralytic ileus. The most common cause of this disseminated infection in immunocompromised patient is due to the following. Identify it.

options.label: C
options.text: Adult female worm of S. stercoralis

options.label: D
options.text: Adult male worm of S. stercoralis

questions.correct_answer: A. Rhabditiform larvae of S. stercoralis
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Rhabditiform larvae of S. stercoralis

questions.text: Which of the following is a risk factor for bladder carcinoma?

A woman at 26-weeks of gestation presents for routine evaluation. On examination, fundal height corresponds to 32 weeks. Ultrasonography revealed increased amniotic fluid. Which of the following conditions would have led to this presentation?

A 21-year-old woman with eclampsia, presents to the emergency. She is given a loading dose of MgSO 4 and delivery is planned. The intern is asked to monitor 3 things: respiratory rate, urine output and deep tendon reflexes. Why is checking the urine output important?

options.label: B
options.text: Renal impairment leads to magnesium toxicity

options.label: C
options.text: Post-partum hemorrhage following delivery can lead to renal impairment

options.label: D
options.text: If urine output is low, it is an indication for dialysis

questions.correct_answer: B. Renal impairment leads to magnesium toxicity
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Renal impairment leads to magnesium toxicity

questions.text: An infant is brought by his parents with complaints that his urine turns black on standing. On doing silver nitrate test, urine sample turned black as shown in the image below. Which of the following metabolic disorders is likely to be present?
In which of the following analyses is monetary benefit quantified?

Seema is a 32-year-old office worker who spends most of her day sitting at her desk typing on her computer. Over the past few weeks, she has been experiencing pain and numbness in her right arm, particularly in her hand and fingers. She has also noticed a weakening grip and occasional tingling sensation in her right arm. Her X-ray neck was performed which is shown here. What is the likely diagnosis?

ASEPSIS wound scoring takes all of the following into consideration except:

A neonate born prematurely at 28 weeks is admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit. She has been diagnosed with congenital heart disease that requires maintenance of ductus arteriosus patency for pulmonary and systemic circulation. The medical team is discussing pharmacological options to keep the ductus arteriosus open. Which of the following helps in maintaining the patency of ductus arteriosus?

A 45-year-old male with a history of recurrent skin infections is admitted to the hospital for cellulitis. He has been treated with penicillin in the past but his current infection is not responding well to the treatment. The healthcare team suspects that the infecting bacteria may produce beta-lactamases and are considering alternative antibiotics. What is the mechanism of resistance by beta-lactamases to penicillin?

A 55-year-old male patient with chronic gout is under consideration for a change in treatment plan due to poor response to conventional therapies like allopurinol and colchicine. The healthcare team is discussing the potential use of pegloticase. What is the mechanism of action of pegloticase?

options.label: B
options.text: Conversion of uric acid to allantoin

questions.correct_answer: B. Conversion of uric acid to allantoin
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Conversion of uric acid to allantoin

questions.text: Which of the following drugs act through intracellular receptors?
A patient with deep vein thrombosis was started on a new drug. After 2 days, he presented with the given finding. Which of the following drugs is implicated in causing the above condition?
A patient present with the following swellings noticed incidentally. According to the CEAP classification, what will be the C stage in this patient?
A patient with retro-positive status was started on 2 nd -line highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART). Which of the following can be used to monitor treatment efficacy?

A 10-year-old boy following a RTA, presents to casualty with contaminated wound over left leg. He has received his complete primary immunization before preschool age and received a booster of DT at school entry age. All of the following can be done, except:
Which one of the following is detected by antigen detection test used for diagnosis of P. falciparum malaria?

The average life expectancy for a Japanese woman stands at 87 years. Thanks to advancements in cervical cancer screening, her life expectancy has increased by a significant 15 years. Given a healthcare utility value of 0.8, what can we determine from these given factors?
Fried egg colonies are produced by:

A 32-year-old male with a 5-year history of schizophrenia controlled on risperidone is seen in the outpatient department. He and his wife of six months, who is currently 8 weeks pregnant, express their concerns about their unborn child's risk of developing the same condition. They mention a recent family gathering where some relatives made disconcerting comments about the hereditary nature of schizophrenia. The husband's medical history is significant for schizophrenia, but there's no other known family history of psychiatric disorders. His wife's family history is unremarkable. They are anxious and request information on the potential genetic risk to their child. Based on the father's diagnosis, what is the approximate risk their child might inherit the condition?
What is a Woronoff ring associated with, in the context of psoriasis?

options.label: B
options.text: Excessive scratching and rubbing in psoriatic plaques

questions.correct_answer: B. Excessive scratching and rubbing in psoriatic plaques
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Excessive scratching and rubbing in psoriatic plaques

questions.text: A concerned mother brings her 2-year-old daughter to the outpatient pediatric clinic. She reports that she has noticed her daughter frequently wringing her hands, displaying an obvious impairment in language and communication development. She mentions episodes where her daughter seems to "hold her breath" and shows noticeable deficits in social interactions compared to other children her age. On further probing, the mother recalls that her daughter's head growth seemed to slow down after she turned 6 months old, even though her initial growth milestones appeared appropriate. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this child?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Rett’s syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective: Differentiate Rett's syndrome from other neurodevelopmental disorders in children based on the classic presentation of hand-wringing, decelerated head growth, and social and communicative impairments. Presence of normal head growth till 6 months of age followed by deceleration points towards Rett’s syndrome.
  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Note: When diagnosing neurodevelopmental disorders, recognizing key clinical presentations and their timelines can significantly narrow down the potential diagnoses. It's essential for clinicians to understand the distinctive features and age of onset for each condition to ensure early intervention and appropriate management.
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry, 9 th edition, Page No. 3548
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry, 9 th edition, Page No. 3548

questions.text: Proteins are mainly formed in soma and then transported toward the axon terminal with the help of various types of molecular motors. All the following proteins are known as molecular motors, because of their involvement in intracellular trafficking except?
Identify the cartilage shown below.

A 77-year-old man, admitted to the ICU for pneumonia for the past four days, has become a challenge for the medical staff. He has grown increasingly irritable and has been attempting to remove his oxygen mask and intravenous cannula. The psychiatry team is consulted to assess his mental state. The nursing staff reports that over the past two days, the patient has been talking to himself as if he were at home, sleeping less, and demonstrating increased irritability. During the mental state examination, the patient appears disheveled and speaks incoherently, often shifting topics and making irrelevant comments. While he recognizes the consulting psychiatrist, he believes he's at home and is unsure of the time. Given this presentation, what neurotransmitter abnormality is most likely contributing to the patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased serotonin in the mesencephalic reticular formation

options.label: B
options.text: Increased serotonin in the mesencephalic reticular formation

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased acetylcholine in the mesencephalic reticular formation

options.label: D
options.text: Increased acetylcholine in the mesencephalic reticular formation

questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased acetylcholine in the mesencephalic reticular formation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Decreased acetylcholine in the mesencephalic reticular formation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective : Understand the central role of cholinergic deficiency, especially decreased acetylcholine in the mesencephalic reticular formation, in the pathogenesis of delirium, emphasizing the need for early recognition and management in the ICU setting.
  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry, 10 th edition, Page No. 1181
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry, 10 th edition, Page No. 1181

questions.text: Which statement is true for initiating an urban community health center?

options.label: A
options.text: Caters to a population of 1-1.5 lakh

options.label: B
options.text: Referral center for 2- 3 primary health centers

options.label: C
options.text: No sub-district and district hospitals present in the area

options.label: D
options.text: Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

questions.correct_answer: D. Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

questions.text: On your evening walk in the park, you notice an unconscious man lying on the ground. What would you do next?

options.label: A
options.text: Check carotid pulse, start CPR, and call for help; Defibrillate if no pulse.

options.label: B
options.text: Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, defibrillate if no pulse

questions.correct_answer: B. Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, defibrillate if no pulse
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, defibrillate if no pulse

questions.text: Which of these is the definition of effective CPR? Respiratory rate: 20 - 24 breaths per minute. Chest compressions: 100-120/min. Allow complete chest recoil. 5-6 cm depression.

A 27-year-old male presents to the outpatient department reporting a several-month history of persistent low mood, feelings of overwhelming guilt, and significant fatigue. He also mentions disturbances in his sleep and appetite. Furthermore, he is distressed about experiencing recent issues with sexual function. He denies any substance use. The patient is seeking intervention to alleviate his symptoms. Which of the following medications is preferred in this case?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Bupropion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Given the patient's presentation and specific concern about sexual dysfunction, bupropion would be the most appropriate choice.
  • ➤ Educational Objective : Understand the side effect profiles of various antidepressants and recognize the importance of selecting a medication based on both the clinical symptoms of depression and the patient's specific concerns or experienced side effects, such as sexual dysfunction. Presence of depressive symptoms with specific concern of sexual dysfunction is an indication for Bupropion.
  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ref: Stahl’s Essential Psychopharmacology, 5 th edition, Page No. 289-304
  • ➤ Ref: Stahl’s Essential Psychopharmacology, 5 th edition, Page No. 289-304

questions.text: A 55-year-old female with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is receiving theophylline as part of her management plan. She reports increased urination since starting the medication. Theophylline causes diuresis by:
A 60-year-old male underwent surgery for rectal prolapse, and a postoperative image was obtained. Can you identify the procedure that was most likely performed on the patient from the given image?
An elderly woman is brought to the OPD with complaints of behavioral change, a history of multiple falls, urinary incontinence, and dementia. What is your diagnosis?
A hypertensive patient who is non-compliant with medication, presents to you with sudden onset breathlessness. A chest X-ray was done, which is shown below. How will you manage this patient?
Pontiac fever is caused by:

A 25-year-old G2A1 with 32-weeks pregnancy presents to the OPD with a feeling of uneasiness. Her BP is 140/90 mmHg. Her lab reports show the following findings: LDH – 800 IU/L, platelets – 65,000/ mm3, serum bilirubin – 1.2 mg/dL, SGOT – 150 U/L, SGPT – 180 U/L. Serum creatine is 0.8 and PT/aPTT are within normal limits. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 48-year-old man with a known history of bipolar disorder was started on sodium valproate two weeks ago for prophylaxis against manic episodes. He is brought to the emergency department by his daughter, who reports that over the past 3 days, he has become progressively more lethargic and confused. He has had difficulty remembering names and was found wandering in the neighborhood earlier in the day. He denies any abdominal pain, headache, or visual disturbances. There is no history of alcohol use, drug abuse, or recent travel. On physical examination, the patient's blood pressure is 116/80 mmHg, pulse is 78/min, and temperature is 98.7°F (37.1°C). Neurological examination reveals no focal deficits, but the patient appears drowsy and disoriented to time and place. His liver function tests return within normal limits. What is the most likely condition responsible for this man's acute presentation?

A child presents with erythematous scaly patches in the perioral region along with mucosal ulcers as shown in the image with impaired epithelial wound healing. What is the likely mineral deficiency associated with this condition?
A 70-year-old male presents with tense bullae on his skin as shown below. Tzanck smear shows no acantholysis. What histological finding is most likely to be observed in the lesions?

A patient with acute otitis media was treated conservatively but he did not follow the complete course. Later, he presents with mild post-auricular pain. PTA showed 30 dB hearing threshold with air-bone gap in hearing frequencies. What could be the possible diagnosis?

Following surgery for varicose veins, the patient is experiencing a complaint of sensory loss in the medial area of the leg and foot. Which of the following nerves is the most probable site of injury?
The blue pipeline in the operation theatre is used for delivering which of the following gases?

A woman experiencing her first pregnancy seeks medical care in an urban setting within the state of Madhya Pradesh, following guidance from an ASHA worker. What financial benefits can they anticipate receiving through the Janani Suraksha Yojana? (ASHA- Accredited social health activist)
questions.correct_answer: A. 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA
questions.explanation: Ans. A. 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA

questions.text: A rural community auxiliary nurse midwife has the responsibility of coordinating a vaccination camp. She has been given two unsealed vials, one containing a pentavalent vaccine and the other an MR vaccine. What are her available strategies for efficiently utilizing these vials?

options.label: A
options.text: Use MR vaccine and discard pentavalent vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department accompanied by his parents. His mother describes an increasing concern: whenever her son walks through a particular dirty street near their home, he becomes extremely distressed, feeling that the dirt has clung to him. Despite cleaning himself thoroughly and understanding rationally that he is clean, he remains consumed by the thought of contamination. This repetitive thought causes him significant distress and anxiety. As a result, he has started avoiding social interactions, fearing contamination. He spends hours ruminating about the dirt and possible contamination, which has, in turn, negatively impacted his academic performance. Given the described presentation, what is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Obsessive compulsive disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective : OCD is characterized by unwanted, repetitive thoughts (obsessions) and actions or rituals (compulsions) that an individual feels driven to perform in response to the obsessions. The description provided aligns closely with the hallmark features of OCD.
  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive textbook of Psychiatry, 10 th edition, Page No. 1785-1798
  • ➤ Ref: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive textbook of Psychiatry, 10 th edition, Page No. 1785-1798
